title: I think I got skipped my 2nd 14-day suspension and went straight to permanent suspension!
body:
Hey, 
around a year ago I got my main account (the one im using right now) banned from flaming,etc. I know that I have flamed a lot, but, I have seen people getting second chances, and I am reformed myself. I have been playing other games for sometime, I think I am ready to take League's stress. I know that my account is permanent suspended. But I have proof of Riot lifting permanent bans, and making them temporary 14-days. I would like myself to be treated that way as a last chance. Thank you.

replies.body:
What proof do you have?

They did this briefly several months ago as an experiment, but itâ€™s very much not their usual practice.

There's no second 14-day suspension to skip. You get one of those with a warning that it's your last opportunity to reform, and then, if you still don't reform, it's a perma. The unbanning experiment ended a long time ago, and I don't think it was a success (people got banned again).
I would love to see the proof of riot unbanning accounts. :)

There have been a few EXTREME occasions.  

One was a 5 man premade that all came forward and said it was a joke report,  another was a borderline case where a rioter stepped in when a person received a 14 day ban while in a game then got reported again and was perma banned by that game before they could get the 14 warning.

There have also been 2-3 off meta bans like singe and nunu there were overturned.

Other then those I can't think of any.    In all of these cases it was either a error due to a extremely rare case of off meta or a error in the system.   The only one that was a flat out over turn was the 5 man,  it was a few years ago and I can't find the link.

Well yeah, but those were either issued "falsely" or, in the case of the 5-man, the reporters came out and said that they were not actually harassed.
I don't think riot has ever overturned a case because "on second sight, the offence was not severe enough to warrant a punishment" or because "the person has clearly reformed since".

I think if the OP was a fringe case like the ones you correctly mention, they would have included that in their post. I could be wrong though and this account was punished for playing syndra ADC

The only times I've seen the perma ban to 14 day ban is when the perma was right on the borderline of being a 14 day ban (player almost reaching reformed level before the incident and such) and sending a particularly polite and understanding message to support. Even then, it is solely up to support whether they think you've earned another chance or they don't want you to be part of the league community anymore.
